text:
wondering what @poolfans building on top of clanker? 

check this thread out to see how tokenizing fees can look like for your project, which supports existing tokens as well as new tokens!

They're also covering clanker from a technical perspective too on their thorough docs, check it out: https://poolfans.gitbook.io/poolfans-docs/guides/clanker

cast.text:
ayo PoolFam this might be too complex if you're not too deep in defi but for those who want to dive in i also made this model in Google Colab: https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1CuBXvMtO_LNThAgKhoNV7I1fubBAjpbw?usp=sharing 
  
üöÄ Model Features:

  1. Bonding Curves (4 types)

  - Linear: Simple proportional pricing
  - Quadratic: Accelerating growth
  - Exponential: Compound growth (recommended)
  - Sigmoid: S-shaped with natural limits

  2. Fee Token Auctions

  - Simulates competitive bidding
  - Calculates optimal token minting
  - Tracks auction efficiency (bid/fee ratio)
  - Analyzes competition effects

  3. Market Dynamics Simulation

  - 30-day trading simulation
  - Buy/sell pressure modeling
  - Protocol fee collection tracking
  - Token burn mechanics
  - Volatility analysis

  4. Price Impact Analysis

  - Calculates slippage for different trade sizes
  - Separate analysis for buys and sells
  - Helps determine optimal trade limits

  5. Reward Distribution

  - Performance-based allocation
  - Proportional distribution
  - Equal distribution options
  - Gini coefficient for inequality measurement

Happy learning and please post your questions/suggestions right in the colab file i made comments available üôè

The CA is: 0x014d482f8403227cf65e1512e94d95606d536b07

show_title: Pichi‚Äôs Mom Enters the Chat (and Brings a Skeleton in Noggles): GM Farcaster ep301
text:
29 Seconds of Farcaster ... What did you miss this weekend?

* The dominating topic this weekend was creator coins & the direction of Base & to some degree Farcaster. It's too much to summarize here, but I think /gmfarcaster will discuss today. I thought it revealed a lot of interesting thoughts from sharp people about the big picture of why we are here--even if at times wrapped in a less than helpful way. But safe to say, it brought out all 37 users and about 43 opinions. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 
(Maybe I should gather the casts for a summary)

* @limone.eth announced that FarCon Rome has dates, a location, as well as a mini app & website to the excitement of many who are going.

* @atown has continued to hold the attention of the timeline with @tryemerge and this weekend released a big feature that you can now upload a photo to use in creating a workflow, elevating FCers creativity

* @haole announced that Recaster (FC client) is going to focus on delivering content and not trading & coin news. He said it's for his own taste, but it seems like if done welll could draw quite a bit of interest from FCers

* @hankmoody does great work in the background to build community and help new people. He was at it this weekend laying out a cluster of apps and tools for new people https://farcaster.xyz/hankmoody/0x5b47730e

* @stevebeachy has a great series on 'Learning Crypto With Sense' and he dropped an explanation of Monad which everyone seems excited about but nobody seems to know what it is https://farcaster.xyz/stevebeachy/0x7ac3a5a3

* @adrienne & @nounishprof are on today at 11:30 AM EST for episode #301 of /gmfarcaster should be a banger show, catching up on this stuff, and then they have their new Clankcaster Spotlight with everyone's favorite @thedude

cast.text:

PSA

Farcaster is adding more crypto functionality, and mobile app store policies in some regions don't allow crypto apps. Other popular wallets also have to follow these rules. A very small number of users will be affected by these changes. 

If you are one of those users, the app will notify you and will let you export both your Farcaster and wallet recovery phrases.

show_title: Pichi‚Äôs Mom Enters the Chat (and Brings a Skeleton in Noggles): GM Farcaster ep301
text: Interesting experiment - let‚Äôs see how long until I‚Äôm out bid

cast.text:
$SIGNET token economics explained üßµ

The app is dead simple. Fully on-chain. Permissionless.

Want to feature your Farcaster cast on the on-chain spotlight?
You buy 100 $SIGNET, your cast takes the spotlight, and those 100 $SIGNET go straight into your wallet. That‚Äôs literally it.

More traffic ‚Üí more spotlight value ‚Üí more motivation to mint ‚Üí higher token price ‚Üí more traffic ‚Üí (the loop keeps turning)

But here‚Äôs the cool part üëá

Every $SIGNET is backed by $HUNT through Mint Club‚Äôs bonding-curve system. When you mint $SIGNET, the contract locks an equivalent amount of $HUNT inside the curve.

So both tokens move together:
more spotlight action ‚Üí more HUNT locked ‚Üí deeper liquidity ‚Üí rising value for both SIGNET and HUNT.

Thick liquidity, tight supply, and a feedback loop powered by community attention.

Current numbers:
- The #1 Trending Mini App on Farcaster
- Market cap ‚âà $82 K
- Liquidity on Mint Club ‚âà $18 K in HUNT (96 000 HUNT locked)
- Liquidity on Uniswap ‚âà $22 K in ETH + SIGNET

That‚Äôs roughly a 48 % liquidity ratio - unusually thick for a microcap.
‚úÖ Low slippage for buyers
‚úÖ Price grounded in real reserves
‚úÖ A sustainable, not hype-driven, loop for both $SIGNET and $HUNT

show_title: Pichi‚Äôs Mom Enters the Chat (and Brings a Skeleton in Noggles): GM Farcaster ep301
text:
i love this place but it‚Äôs not getting any better. 

i talk to four or five builders every single day, and over the past few weeks, the tides have started to turn. almost everyone i‚Äôve spoken to who‚Äôs trying to build a real, scalable product with the intention of surviving across cycles is seriously questioning the direction of base & exploring alternatives. it‚Äôs heartbreaking. 

nobody ‚Äî not a single person i‚Äôve spoken to ‚Äî wants creator coins. not one. the only people building in that vertical are the ones trying to fix the very problems they created.

we‚Äôre perpetually pushing ten people on zora all with deep coinbase relationships. what does this have to do with base blockchain? half of them aren‚Äôt even builders & more than half of them won‚Äôt be here in a year. can we be honest about that? it‚Äôs not even because they‚Äôre bad ideas, but because they launched on a creator coin launchpad that makes zero sense. are they creator coins? are these projects? why is there a trading competition? none of this makes sense. why are we forcing a square peg into a round hole just to sustain a broken narrative that doesn‚Äôt make sense? 

do you know what builders really want?
they want a faster chain. they want gas stability & sponsorships. they want $10k checks. they want to build on YOUR blockchain, not build around it, not forced into an app chain or elsewhere.

you ARE the blockchain. build the blockchain & support the folks building on it. that‚Äôs all they want. that is your only job. 

instead, we‚Äôre throwing invalidated shit at the wall ‚Äî doubling, tripling, quadrupling down on failing, directionless projects while real, multi-person teams with momentum & traction get ignored. we hide behind greed, ignorance & inertia, pretending not to see what‚Äôs happening right in front of us. talk to the people. this isn‚Äôt good. they are not happy. they are leaving. you think i‚Äôm loud for clout on a 100 person network? i am loud because these builders are my friends; because i am building with them. i‚Äôm loud because they don‚Äôt care to be: they are ready to throw in the gloves.

we‚Äôve learned nothing from the lessons that came before ‚Äî from friend tech, from virtuals, from zora x5, from farcaster, from tba, from crypto itself over the last eight years ‚Äî why are we ignoring all of it? why?

do we really not see this? again? for the nth time? this only goes ONE way. please, can we be real? farcaster tried to build for creators for THREE years & got NOWHERE. what about lens? what about every single attempt before? what about the last 5 zora models? cmon, man‚Ä¶

these are people‚Äôs livelihoods; these builders have families, children, spouses. they quit their jobs to build on YOUR chain; to strengthen YOUR network, to make YOU money.

why are we doing this?

and now, we‚Äôre about to push another unvalidated model as if Jesus came down from the heavens & wrote the code himself ‚Äî one that lets founders dump FIFTY PRECENT of their token on their holders, with zero connection to fundamentals, revenue, product, or users. just another attention game, another cycle of manipulation‚Ä¶

zero validation, yet we‚Äôre rolling it out across multiple pads, multiple teams, as THE model that will feed the hungry, pushing it top-down. come on.

we laughed at binance for asking 8% for a listing. the whole base community joined in: ‚Äúhow absurd! we don‚Äôt want the largest exchange in the world dumping on us!‚Äù and yet here we are, pushing creator coins with fifty percent insider ownership whose ENTIRE purpose is to be dumped on their own communities‚Ä¶ launchpads with fifty percent insider ownership whose ENTIRE purpose is to be dumped on their own communities‚Ä¶

it‚Äôs just sad. genuinely sad; and it‚Äôs painful to hear the same thing, every day, from people who‚Äôve been here for years. 

i just don‚Äôt get it anymore.

cast.text:
We‚Äôre launching creator coins in the Base app.

Why? Because creators deserve to own the upside of everything they make, and their communities should be rewarded for being part of it. Creator coins make this real.

Creator coins are in early access. We‚Äôre starting with a small group to shape the foundation and build the best tools to support them.

These coins let creators:
‚Üí Create and earn, globally
‚Üí Build lasting value from the content they create, benefitting from long-term growth and active trading
‚Üí Reward their audience

Built with @zora on the Base app.

show_title: Pichi‚Äôs Mom Enters the Chat (and Brings a Skeleton in Noggles): GM Farcaster ep301
text:
This is a great read from @itsbasil, tho a touch cynical even for me. ;)

I'll preface this long thread with the fact that I love what @barmstrong, @jesse.base.eth, and the @base.base.eth team are building. 

Also: I'm not an armchair quarterback here. I am a builder/creator with a spouse, children, and bills. I'm all-in on Base with Birthday Labs and that's why I care. I'll support and build even through strategic disagreement.

My concern is a bit orthogonal to Basil's, and related to my "credible neutrality" post: the folks building the infrastructure are also the tastemakers.

I believe Base should be neutral, but it's not.

If their opinionated approach with @baseapp.base.eth doesn't work, Base as a chain will suffer, whether we like it or not. 

Philosophically this isn't the case, as the two are distinct endeavors, but practically speaking they are inextricably linked. Not just in name.

In a real way, Base the L2 (not just TBA the consumer product) is betting the farm on creator coins.

My take?
Base should ùò¥ùò∞ùò≠ùò¶ùò≠ùò∫ focus on builders, developers, startups.

Let us worry about creators, consumers, products.

Put another way: Base Build, Base Ecosystem Fund, & CDP should have ùò™ùòØùòßùò™ùòØùò™ùòµùò¶ùò≠ùò∫ more attention, cheerleading, and hard resources than TBA.

Let startups and builders figure out consumer products, product-market fit, and tokenomics. 

Give us robust, canonical onchain primitives, similar to what @dwr, @v, and Farcaster are doing with the social graph. 

Don't add cognitive load to devs who have to support Farcaster and TBA with differing APIs and approaches. Easy to say "you can just choose not to!", but it's literally ùòµùò©ùò¶ ùòâùò¢ùò¥ùò¶ ùò¢ùò±ùò±. Practically speaking, there's no choice.

Let builders build.

I think the opportunity Base has is MASSIVE. I pray they'll get it right.

https://farcaster.xyz/itsbasil/0x394d787c

i just don‚Äôt get it anymore. https://farcaster.xyz/baseapp.base.eth/0xbacdc414

show_title: Pichi‚Äôs Mom Enters the Chat (and Brings a Skeleton in Noggles): GM Farcaster ep301
text:
For as long as I've been working in crypto, people have been trying crypto-social experiments aimed at rewarding content creators. I know because I've been one of those people. I previously cofounded Cent, a web3 social network that ran a ton of different experiments: incentivized upvotes, incentivized subscriptions, incentivized subscriptions, you name it. Our "breakout" moment was when we tokenized posts and sold Jack Dorsey's first tweet as an NFT. Before us, there was Steemit. After us, came Bitclout, then Friendtech, and most recently Zora. History does not repeat, but it certainly does rhyme. 

Intuitively, it makes sense that if you're creating something, and millions of people are consuming it, it has value. But the path to realizing that value has historically been loosely correlated. At best, you'll get a sponsorship deal, some paid subscribers, or revenue from ads. But the incentives always feel tacked on, because they ARE tacked on. The expectation is that first, you must create "for free." If you don't, someone else will. Getting capital "upfront" is an assumption I don't expect to change. 

Recently, there has been a push, particularly from the Base team, to tokenize creativity on Zora. The intentions are pure and good: creators want more money, and web3/internet capital should be able to deliver that somehow. The disconnect lies in what most creators do not - and will not - do: make themselves the subject for others' profit and loss. This model is actually WORSE than the models of the previous era - labels, galleries, platforms, et al ‚Äì because now the loss is no longer just the artist's to bear. It's on their fans, too. The ones who bought their coins after snipers, the ones who are sitting on losses, the ones who are exit liquidity if - god forbid - an artist wants to reap some of the benefit for themselves and sell.

In many senses, memecoin traders are worse than labels. Their time preference is high. There are no long-term commitments, they're not dependable, they're always looking for the next place to reallocate their poker chips. If you're an artist, you probably don't want retail funding your creativity this way. You think your label or manager is annoying? Try a horde of psuedo-anon tokenholders busting your balls on your token price. 

No fucking thanks.

show_title: Pichi‚Äôs Mom Enters the Chat (and Brings a Skeleton in Noggles): GM Farcaster ep301
text:
I don't think Farcaster is going to fail. 

I don't think Base is failing.

The discussions about both "failing" is because we care.

You don't find that non price related care in 99% of ecosystems.

We have something special here.

glad to see the discussions

Though I always remind myself of the above
